li.div:
If your child will be five years of age on or before August 31, 2020, they are eligible to attend kindergarten in the 2020-2021 school year.
This year, enrollment will take place on-line. Click the link to the left under QUICK LINKS > Kindergarten Registration Packet.
Requirements for kindergarten are: a birth certificate, up-to-date immunizations and all forms completed. Starting the 2020-2021 school year, all immunizations must be completed before your child may start the school year.

img.div:
On April 6, 2020, Governor Inslee announced schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, in order to slow the spread of COVID-19. Without these restrictions, public health authorities say the rate of infection will overwhelm the healthcare system.
We acknowledge continued school closures are difficult for students, staff, families and our entire community. This is disappointing news for all of us: students miss their friends and teachers, and we miss our students. The extended closure also raises numerous questions for students and families. We are working to answer your questions as soon as possible. In the meantime, here is what we know now:
• Distance learning will continue through June 19. We are committed to continuing to partner with families and community to support our students’ learning while they are at home.
•We will continue to prioritize support for our high school seniors to ensure they have what they need for post-secondary transitions. We are working with the state’s college system to ensure smooth transitions.
•We will continue to provide meals for students.
•If your child needs a device, please contact your child’s school principal.
•All events, including athletics, dances and scheduled school trips, are canceled. We are engaging with students to come up with creative alternatives to celebrate milestones such as prom and graduation. We will keep students and families updated.
•In-person graduation ceremonies will be modified to virtual ceremonies and/or postponed. We will communicate plans as soon as possible.
We will continue to support our students and families during this difficult time. We are committed to delivering the very best education possible in these unprecedented circumstances and to doing all we can to support students’ well-being.
If you have questions, please contact your child’s school principal. We are a strong community, and we will get through this together.

li.div:
Your participation will help keep this program open. All children welcome.
Emergency School Closure - Free Meals
NEW STARK RD SITE
WHO: All Children ages 0-18
WHERE:
• Main Site – Middle School bus parking area, walk-up and drive-thru style
• Gleed Site - Memorial Bible Church parking area, walk-up and drive-thru style: 111 Old Stage Way
• Wenas Site - On Conrad Rd, near Longmire Ln
• Nile Site - The Woodshed gravel parking lot: 8520 Hwy 410
• Stark Rd Site - Near 141 Stark Rd, walk-up and drive-thru style
WHEN: April 13 through June 19, Monday through Friday
• Middle School - 10:30am to 12:00pm
• Gleed, Wenas, & Nile sites – 11:00am to 12:00pm
• Stark Rd site - 12:15pm to 12:45pm
HOW: Each child will receive two meals, served at the same time: lunch for that day and breakfast for the following morning. ALL CHILDREN WELCOME.
Child must be present to receive meal. Participants are expected to utilize appropriate social distancing techniques.
COST: Free for ALL children
Cierre de la Escuela de Emergencia - Comidas Gratuitas
NUEVO - STARK RD SITIO
QUIÉN: Todos los Niños de 0 a 18 años
DONDE: Middle School Sitio - Zona de estacionamiento para autobuses junto de la
Middle School, caminar y conducir a través del estilo
Gleed Sitio - Memorial Bible Church, caminar y conducir a través del estilo:
111 Old Stage Way, Yakima 98908
Wenas Sitio - En Conrad Rd, cerca de Longmire Ln, conducir a través del estilo
Nile Sitio - The Woodshed: 8520 Hwy 410, Naches
Stark Rd Sitio - Cerca de 141 Stark Rd, caminar y conducir a través del estilo
CUÁNDO: Del 13 de abril hasta el 19 de junio, de lunes a viernes
Middle School Sitio (horus extendido) - 10:30 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.
Gleed, Wenas, & Nile Sitios - 11:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.
Stark Rd Sitio - 12:15 p.m. a 12:45 p.m.
COMO: Cada niño recibirá dos comidas, servidas al mismo tiempo: almuerzo para ese día y desayuno para la mañana siguiente. TODOS LOS NIÑOS SON BIENVENIDOS.
El niño debe estar presente para recibir comida. Se espera que los participantes utilicen técnicas de distanciamiento social apropiadas.
COSTO: Gratis para TODOS los niños

div.h3: Due to COVID19 - All Enrollment packets must be submitted via email.
div.p: In light of all that has been happening with school closures and stay at home order from Governor Inslee. We are offering our school enrollment packet in a fillable PDF form. Please read the instructions below. Should you have questions please do not hesitate to call (509)653-2220.
If you are new or a returning family to our school district and need to enroll your student please follow these few steps:
1. Down load the fillable PDF - Enrollment English/ Enrollment Spanish
2. Once you have filled out the forms save the document to your desktop.
3. Submit the forms via email to the school your student will be attending by using one of the following emails addresses:

div.i: (Please include a copy of your child's birth certificate and/or Social security card along with the vaccination records.)

div.div: Si usted es una nueva familia en nuestro distrito escolar y necesita inscribir a su estudiante por favor siga estos pasos:
1. Carga descendente el PDF rellenable - Inscripción En inglés/ Español de inscripción
2. Una vez que haya rellenado los formularios, guarde el documento en su escritorio.
3. Envíe los formularios por correo electrónico a la escuela a la que asistirá su estudiante utilizando una de las siguientes direcciones de correo electrónico:

div.i: (Incluya una copia del certificado de nacimiento de su hijo y/o tarjeta de seguro social junto con los registros de vacunación.)

span.data-emptytext: Naches Valley School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value: Naches School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee(s) has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Civil Rights Coordinator: Robert Bowman, 509-653-1802, rbowman@nvsd.org; Title IX Coordinator: Rich Rouleau, 509-653-1601, rrouleau@nvsd.org; and 504 Coordinator: Lori Gylling, 509-653-1813, lgylling@nvsd.org. Address: P.O. Box 99, 24 Shafer Ave., Naches WA 98937.

p.span: Naches School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee(s) has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Civil Rights Coordinator: Robert Bowman, 509-653-1802, rbowman@nvsd.org; Title IX Coordinator: Rich Rouleau, 509-653-1601, rrouleau@nvsd.org; and 504 Coordinator: Lori Gylling, 509-653-1813, lgylling@nvsd.org. Address: P.O. Box 99, 24 Shafer Ave., Naches WA 98937.

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
